name: Chapter 12: Ways to Interact with AWS
description: Flashcards covering the main methods to interact with AWS services: Console, CLI, and SDKs.

cards.front: You're new to AWS and want a user-friendly, visual interface to manage services. What should you use?
cards.back: Use the AWS Management Console—a web-based dashboard that offers search, graphics, and guided workflows for managing AWS services.
cards.example: Just like a pizza shop touchscreen lets you adjust ovens or reorder ingredients, the Console lets you do the same for AWS services without needing code.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Introduction to Information Technology and AWS Cloud

glossary.definition: A web-based interface for accessing and managing AWS services with visual tools and wizards.
A mobile version of the AWS Console for on-the-go monitoring and management.

cards.front: How can you quickly issue repeatable commands and automate AWS tasks without using a visual interface?
cards.back: Use the AWS CLI (Command Line Interface), which lets you type commands or use scripts to manage AWS services more efficiently.
cards.example: Like texting your kitchen to 'start oven' or 'add dough,' CLI lets you run commands like `aws ec2 start-instances` or automate them in scripts.
cards.mnemonic: Type to run your shop. Script to run it smarter.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Introduction to Information Technology and AWS Cloud

glossary.definition: A command-line tool for managing AWS services and automating tasks with scripts.
A file containing a sequence of commands to automate repetitive tasks.

cards.front: How do developers integrate AWS functionality directly into their own apps or software?
cards.back: By using AWS SDKs—language-specific libraries that allow you to call AWS services programmatically from your application code.
cards.example: Just like a pizza app can connect to ovens and delivery routes, an app using an AWS SDK can spin up EC2 instances or write to DynamoDB automatically.
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Introduction to Information Technology and AWS Cloud

glossary.definition: A set of libraries that enables developers to call AWS services directly from their preferred programming languages.
A set of functions and protocols that allows software applications to communicate with each other.
